title: High school student found shot to death in front yard
content:
COLLEGE PARK, Ga. -- A 15-year-old high school student was found dead in a front yard Thursday morning.
According to Clayton County police, officers responding to a person down call in the 1100 block of Kristen Cove found the teen lying face down on the front lawn around 8:15 a.m. First responders determined that he was deceased.
The teen was identified as 15-year-old Keyontae "Jeremiah" Ross, a student at North Clayton High School. The house he was found in front of is located about a mile from the apartment complex where he lives, police said.
Neighbors said they heard gunshots around 10 p.m. on Wednesday.
Family members said that Ross left his home around 7 p.m. and wasn't seen again.
"Jeremiah was great," said Dewanna Crawford, the victim's aunt. "He was always a loner. He liked to go out and do things by himself, so when he would go out, we would expect for him to come home, because that's just what he did. He will be missed, truly."
Ross had moved to the area from Stockbridge in September, according to his family.
The investigation into the shooting is ongoing.
"It's a 15-year-old, and despite what he may or may not have been doing at that location, a 15-year-old has lost his life," said Mjr. Joseph Woodall with the Clayton County Police Department. "It brings concern to us all and we're going to treat it accordingly and hope to get to the bottom of it shortly."
Anyone with information on the death is asked to call 911.
